intro: Galium jordanii var. fleurotii, commonly known as Jordan's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to specific regions in the Middle East and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
